info.description: Public REST APIs for Payroll Interface
info.title: globalPayroll

tags.name: authorizations
tags.description: For each target id check whether subjectId has access to that target for the specified featureId

tags.name: effectiveChanges
tags.description: Generates effective change data for organizations or workers based on request parameters.

tags.name: eventDrivenIntegrationVendorResponse
tags.description: Provides access to get and post Event Driven Integration Vendor Response information

tags.name: payGroups
tags.description: Provides access to Payroll Interface pay group information and management of their payroll periods.

get.summary: Retrieves a Payroll Interface pay group.
get.description: Retrieves a Payroll Interface pay group with the specified ID. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll Interface (Update Pay Period Status) Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Check subjectId permissions against featureId for each target Id
post.description: Check subjectId permissions against featureId for each target Id Secured by: View: Global Payroll Authorizations Scope: Global Payroll Connect

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A2378 | Specify a valid featureId ([feature]).
A2379 | Specify a valid worker ID for subjectId ([subject]).
A2380 | Specify a valid id for [targets]

post.summary: Updates a specific vendor response instance of Event-Driven Integration with the specified data after the third-party payroll system completes processing of the worker changes.
post.description: Updates a specific vendor response instance of Event-Driven Integration with the specified data after the third-party payroll system completes processing of the worker changes. The third-party payroll system updates the overall status of the processing and payroll error messages and warnings, if any. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll Interface (Update Vendor Response for Event-Driven Integration) Scope: Payroll Interface

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A917 | Could not find Event Driven Integration Event for id provided in request.
A918 | Event Driven Integration event is no longer valid for update.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of payroll periods for the specified Payroll Interface pay group ID.
get.description: Retrieves all payroll periods for the specified Payroll Interface pay group ID and sorts in descending order by the period end date. Secured by: REST API Public

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: periodEndDate
parameters.description: The end date of a payroll period using the yyyy-mm-dd format. This should not be used with the showMostRecentOnly query parameter. If both periodEndDate and showMostRecentOnly query parameters are provided, the API will only consider the periodEndDate query parameter.

parameters.name: showMostRecentOnly
parameters.description: If true, the operation returns the 5 most recent pay periods. This should not be used with periodEndDate query parameter. If both showMostRecentOnly and periodEndDate query parameters are provided, the API will ignore showMostRecentOnly query parameter.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single Event-Driven Integration vendor response.
get.description: Retrieves an Event-Driven Integration vendor response with the specified ID. Secured by: Global Payroll System, Set Up: Payroll Interface (Update Vendor Response for Event-Driven Integration) Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: POST Inbound Notifications request. Secured by: Manage: Global Payroll Inbound Notifications Scope: Global Payroll Connect

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1857 | Use the Integration System User (ISU) account associated with the external payroll vendor mapping.
A2262 | Specify either workerRecipients or organizationsRecipients.
A2263 | Specify valid workerRecipients or valid organizationRecipients. If you specify organizationRecipients, also specify at least 1 organization and role.
A2302 | Specify a valid feature property value for [featurePropertyList]
A2404 | If you specify a translation, also specify a unique non-english translation title, translation body, and translation language. Invalid languages:  [Invalids]
A2405 | If you specify featureConfiguration, also specify 1 valid feature.
A2406 | Specify valid feature properties for [feature]. Valid feature properties are [validPropertyNames].

get.summary: Retrieves a payroll period for the specified Payroll Interface pay group ID.
get.description: Retrieves a payroll period with the specified Payroll Interface pay group ID. Secured by: REST API Public

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

patch.summary: Partially updates an existing pay period by the specified pay group ID.
patch.description: Partially updates an existing payroll period for the specified Payroll Interface pay group ID and the provided data in the request body. Secured by: REST API Public

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A543 | Invalid status. Must be one of the following: Not Yet Started, In Progress, Complete
A544 | Missing 'status' field. Must be one of the following: Not Yet Started, In Progress, Complete

post.summary: Generates effective change data for organizations or workers based on request parameters.
post.description: Generates effective change data for organizations or workers based on request parameters. Secured by: Manage: Data Changes On Demand Scope: Global Payroll Connect

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1670 | Specify these pay groups for the Data Changes on Demand feature on the Maintain Pay Group Vendor Associations task for the external payroll vendor associated to the Integration System User: [pgs]
A1704 | When you set schemaOnly to false, you must specify these fields: organizations, effectiveTo, effectiveFrom, entryMomentTo, entryMomentFrom, fieldSetVersion and changeDetection.
A1705 | When you set schemaOnly to true, you can't specify any other fields.
A1709 | Specify an effectiveTo date that's on or after the effectiveFrom date.
A1710 | Specify an integration system with the Data Changes on Demand integration template.
A1711 | Specify an entryMomentTo datetime that's after the entryMomentFrom datetime.
A1712 | Specify active payroll interface pay groups. These organizations aren't active payroll interface pay groups: [pgs]
A1749 | Specify fieldSetVersion with a value of v1 or greater.
A1792 | Specify countryRegionNameFormat with a value of COUNTRY_REGION_ID, COUNTRY_REGION_NAME, ISO_3166-2_CODE, or ISO_3166-2_COUNTRY_REGION_CODE. If no value supplied, the default is ISO_3166-2_CODE.
A1793 | Specify countryNameFormat with a value of COUNTRY_NAME, ISO_3166-1_ALPHA-2_CODE, or ISO_3166-1_ALPHA-3_CODE. If no value supplied, the default is ISO_3166-1_ALPHA-2_CODE.
A1851 | A prior record with the same entry parameters must exist when setting forceRerun to true.
A1857 | Use the Integration System User (ISU) account associated with the external payroll vendor mapping.
A1857 | Use the Integration System User (ISU) account associated with the external payroll vendor mapping.
A2260 | You can't run a Data Changes on Demand integration event because the number of workers for all of the processing pay groups exceeds the maximum worker count. Work with your implementation partner to split up the pay groups.
A2264 | Specify an entryMomentFromOverride datetime that is before the entryMomentTo datetime.
A2265 | If you specify workerOverrides, specify a valid ID for a \~worker\~ and entryMomentFromOverride.
A2266 | If you specify workerOverrides, specify a unique \~worker\~ ID for each \~worker\~. You can't have duplicate \~workers\~ within the workerOverrides request parameter.
A2285 | Specify a different entryMomentFrom value or an entryMomentTo value so the range is less than 2 months.
A2285 | Specify a different entryMomentFromOverride value or an entryMomentTo value for these workers so the range is less than 2 months: [workers]
A2293 | The effectiveFrom date you specified doesn't have an associated pay period. Either specify a different effectiveFrom date or create a pay period for these organizations: [pgs]
A2295 | Specify 1 or more valid field path IDs for requestCriteria.fields.onlyInclude.
A2318 | You can only have 1 Data Changes on Demand integration system for all third-party payroll systems in the target tenant. Remove any additional Data Changes on Demand integration systems in the Workday target tenant.
A2353 | If you set allEffective as true, remove the extendedAllEffectiveTo request parameter.
A2354 | Specify the range for effectiveTo and extendedAllEffectiveTo to 93 days or less.
A2355 | Specify an extendedAllEffectiveTo that is equal to or greater than effectiveTo.
A2356 | If you set allEffective as true, specify the range for effectiveFrom and effectiveTo to 93 days or less.
A2486 | Specify an effectiveFrom date that's within 186 days of the entryMomentTo date if the effective range is greater than 403 days.
A2519 | You have reached the maximum of 25 in-progress events for jobs containing 1 worker for this vendor. Wait for 1 of the events to complete before launching another.
A2520 | You have reached the maximum of 5 in-progress events for jobs containing 2 or more workers for this vendor. Wait for 1 of the events to complete before launching another.
A2557 | You can't specify both time off and grouped time off in the same request. Specify the request parameter requestCriteria.fields.onlyInclude for either timeOffEarningsAndDeductions or groupedTimeOffEarningsAndDeductions.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of Payroll Interface pay groups.
get.description: Retrieves all Payroll Interface pay groups and sorts by name in ascending alphabetical order. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll Interface (Update Pay Period Status) Scope: Payroll Interface

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

errorMessageSet_8c3b1d133c4810000c7b576d.description: A container for Third Party Payroll Errors returned for the worker changes sent through Event-Driven Integration.

overallStatus_8c3b1d133c4810000c37563654.description: The Workday ID or reference ID of the processing status the third-party payroll vendor returns for the worker changes sent to the third-party payroll system with the Event-Driven Integration. The reference ID uses the referenceIdType=sampleRefId format. Example: SUCCESSFULLY_SENT_TO_PAYROLL.

setLsrd.description: If true, Workday updates the LSRD for that particular worker. The next time you run the batch PECI integration, only changes that occurred after running the Event-Driven Integration is included for the worker. If false, Workday sends the original data again during the next transmission, either through the event-driven integration or the Payroll Effective Change Interface integration.

skipReviewReason.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
skipReviewReason.description: The reason that gives guidance whether or not to complete the Maintain Local Payroll Data step after the Review Event Driven Integration for Third Party Payroll step. This field applies when you configured the Hire business process with the Maintain Local Payroll Data step right after the Review Event Driven Integration for Third Party Payroll step. Workday displays this reason on the Maintain Local Payroll Data task after the Review Event Driven Integration for Third Party Payroll step.

id.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
id.description: Required Workday ID for the Event-Driven Integration. Workday provides this to the third-party payroll vendor as part of the initial file delivery.

skipReview.description: If true, Workday displays the Review Event Driven Integration for Third Party Payroll step on the Maintain Local Payroll Data task.

relaunchable.description: If true, Workday displays the Resend to Payroll button on the Review Event Driven Integration for Third Party Payroll step to resubmit worker changes after making any corrections. If false, Workday doesn't display the button. The field might be set to false if there isnâ€™t anything the user can do to fix the errors and resubmitting the changes will result in the same errors.

responseFilter_9ec52ffec9a0100015ac1c8cc.description: Response Filter for Data Changes on Demand Request.

extendedAllEffectiveTo.description: Upper limit of the optional extended all effective range.

includeRequestCriteriaInResponse.description: Default is false. When true, the original request will be shown in the response.

entryMomentTo.description: The date up until which the entry moment for the request should query data for.

entryMomentFrom.description: The date from which the entry moment for the request should query data for.

effectiveTo.description: The date up until which the entry moment for the request should query data for.

forceRerun.description: This boolean is used to force a new request to be generated even if the same parameters as a prior request are sent. Force Rerun should only be used if the previous request is complete or has failed for some reason.

excludeWorkers.description: If set to true, \~workers\~ in the "workers" request parameter will be excluded from the output. By default, the parameter is inclusive.

allEffective.description: Default is false. Only set to true if you want all effective changes in the effective range. Otherwise, it will only give incremental changes entered within the entry range.

organizations.description: Organization for external data request (e.g. pay group).

effectiveFrom.description: The date from which the effective moment for the request should query data for.

schemaOnly.description: If true, the API only returns the schema file. If false, the API returns the schema file and other output files. Use this option to identify available API fields and map to external vendor fields as needed.
